page.title: 09THE BROILER UNIT
page.content: Like the piggery this is part of a larger chicken rearing and marketing organisation. The unit is situated on the old airfield. Day old chicks are brought here from the hatchery at Kinross to be reared. The chicks run free on the floor of 8 large sheds and are fed a special wheat mix prepared by the company. Great care must be taken to ensure that the temperature remains at the correct setting as the birds grow. Special alarm systems are built in to prevent overheating or break down of the electrical hot air system. When the chickens are 6 to 7 weeks old they are sent to the firm's factory at Coupar Angus where they are killed and prepared for market. The labour force at the unit consists of a manager, a foreman and 3 workers. The chicken manure is given away free to local farmers.
